children.name: distance
children.definition: the amount of space between two places or things
examples: distance from/between
the distance from Chicago to Detroit
Measure the distance between the two points.
The cottage issome distance(= quite a long distance )from the road.
distance from sth to sth
What is the distance from New York to Miami?
the distance between sth and sth
Measure the distance between the window and the door.
at a distance of 2 feet/10 metres etc
A shark can smell blood at a distance of half a kilometer.
Register
In everyday English, when talking about how far something is, people often use an expression such ashow farora long/short wayrather than the noundistance:
What is thedistancefrom Chicago to Detroit?➔How faris it from Chicago to Detroit? | The cottage is somedistancefrom the road.➔The cottage isa long wayfrom the road.

children.name: a long/great/considerable distance
examples: The sound of guns seemed a long distance away.

children.name: a short distance
examples: I quickly walked the short distance to the car.

children.name: a safe distance
children.definition: enough space to be safe
examples: You should keep a safe distance from the car in front.

children.name: some distance
children.definition: quite a long distance
examples: He heard a scream some distance away.

children.name: vast distances
examples: The aircraft is able to carry huge loads over vast distances.

children.name: the stopping/braking distance
children.definition: how far you travel in a car after pressing the brakes
examples: What’s the stopping distance at 30 miles an hour?

children.name: travel a great/long etc distance
examples: In some countries children must travel great distances to school each day.

children.name: measure the distance between things
examples: Now we are able to measure the distances between the planets.

children.name: judge distances
children.definition: judge how much space there is between things
examples: Animals that hunt can judge distances very well.

children.name: within
children.definition: easy
examples: walking distance(= near enough to walk to easily )There are lots of restaurants within walking distance.

children.name: within travelling/commuting/driving distance of something
children.definition: near enough to make travel to or from a place possible
examples: The job was not within travelling distance of my home.

children.name: within striking distance of something
children.definition: not far from something, especially something you are going to attack
examples: Their troops had advanced to within striking distance of the town.

children.name: within spitting distanceinformal
children.definition: very near something
examples: The ball passed within spitting distance of the goal.

children.name: put some distance between yourself and sb/sth
children.definition: go quite a long way from them
examples: He wanted to put some distance between himself and his pursuers.

children.name: how far
children.definition: use this to ask what the distance is between where you are and another place:cách bao xa

children.name: ‘How far is Newark?’ ‘It’s about 200 miles.’
examples: how far is it to...?
How far is it to the nearest gas station?

children.name: from
children.definition: if one place is 10 kilometres/30 miles/20 minutes etc from another place, that is the distance between the two places, or the time it takes to get from one to the other:từ
examples: Seattle is about 100 miles from the Canadian border.
The junior high school is five minutes from our house.
She was standing just a couple of metres from the edge of the cliff.

children.name: away
children.definition: if a place or person is 10 kilometres/30 miles/20 minutes etc away, they are that distance from where you are, or it takes that amount of time to travel there:cách
examples: The nearest village was about 20 miles away.
Toronto’s only about an hour and a half away by car.

children.name: away from
examples: The station is about two miles away from the city centre.
He was standing three metres away from the bomb when it exploded.

children.name: off U
children.definition: off if sth is 10 kilometres/30 metres etc off, that is how far it is from you or from the place you are talking about:cách từ
examples: The nearest town is fifteen kilometres off.
The robbers must be a long way off by now.
We were still several miles off, but you could already see a glow in the sky from the lights of the city.

children.name: apart
children.definition: if two places, objects, or people are three miles, two centimetres etc apart, that is the distance between them:cách nhau
examples: The seeds should be planted a few inches apart.
The two towns are fifteen miles apart.
We were standing a few feet apart from each other.

children.name: well apartwide apart
examples: Stand on the skis with your feet well apart.

children.name: far aparta long way apart
examples: The National Weather Service is forecasting snow in cities as far apart as Atlanta, Boston, and Cleveland.

children.name: a long way
children.definition: a long/short way use this to say how far one place is from another or from where you are: chặng đường dài, đoạn đường ngắn

children.name: a long/short way from
examples: California is a long way from Georgia.
Only a short way from the buildings is the impressive entrance to Bruntscar Cave.

children.name: a long/short way away
examples: Oxford is just a short way away. You can make the drive in under an hour.

children.name: to continue for a particular distance
reach
children.definition: 1 the distance that you can stretch out your arm to touch sth :tầm tay; tầm với
examples: 2[CS or U]within (easy) reach of sthclose to a place :
The beach is within easy reach of the hotel.
We livewithin (easy)reach of the station.

children.name: out of/beyond (sb’s) reach
examples: Keep chemicals out of the reach of children.
The top shelf iswithin/out of(his) reach.
Make sure that you keep all dangerous substancesout ofthe reachofthe children.

children.name: within reach (of sb)
examples: Keep a glass of water within reach.
I like to keep a notebook and pencilwithin (arm's)reach.

children.name: extend
children.definition: to continue over a particular distance, especially a long distance:mở rộng

children.name: extend around/over/through etc
examples: From the corner of the terrace the path extended down to the sea.

children.name: extend from sth to sth
examples: The valley extends from Vassai in the north to Momere in the southwest.

children.name: extend for
examples: The estuary extends for over 100 miles.

children.name: range
children.definition: the distance that something can travel over or reach:phạm vi

children.name: range of
examples: The rockets have a range of 4000 km.
A typical radio signal has a range of about 100 miles.

children.name: within rangeat a distance that is less than the range
examples: As soon as the tanks came within range, the soldiers opened fire.

children.name: out of rangeat a distance greater than the range
examples: The enemy were just out of range of our cannon.
The demonstrators were hurling rocks but the police stayed out of range.

children.name: stretch
children.definition: to continue over a particular distance, especially a long distance:mở rộng

children.name: stretch around/over/ through etc
examples: The desert stretches over five different countries.

children.name: stretch from sth to sth
examples: The valley stretches from Vassai in the north to Momere in the southwest.

children.name: stretch for
examples: The estuary stretches for over 100 miles.

children.name: length
children.definition: how long sth is: bề dài, chiều dài
examples: Do you want your hair at the back to be the same length as the sides?
Try these trousers, they look about the right length.
length of
Measure the length of all three sides of the triangle.
The windows stretch across the whole length of the wall.
a length of 4 feet/three inches etc
These fish can grow to a length of four feet.
5 miles/12 inches etc in length
The leaves reach 20-25 cm in length0.
in length
The two pieces of rope were unequal in length.
of equal lengthwhen two things are of the same length
Actually, no-one has legs of exactly equal length.
full-length[adj] as long as it is possible for sth to be:
There were even full-length mirrors in all the lifts.
a full-length fur coat
-lengthsuffixlong enough to reach the stated place
a knee-length skirt/ knee-length socks
shoulder-length hair

children.name: long
children.definition: six feet/two metres etc
examples: The room is about 10 metres long and 5 metres wide.
Some snakes can grow up to 30 feet long.
To read a report that’s over 40 pages long? It would take me most of the day.

children.name: how long
examples: How long is the trailer? I don’t think it will fit in the garage.
Look how long Ayesha’s hair is getting.
Get me a measuring tape - I’ll show you how long I want the skirt.

children.name: travelling or reaching over a long distance
long-range
children.definition: long-range missile/gun/bomber etca weapon that can hit sth far away: cự li dài
examples: There are fears that the country has produced long-range missiles capable of reaching across the border.

children.name: long-distance
children.definition: long-distance trade/ transport/ telephone call etcbetween places that are a long way away from each other: đường dài
examples: Long-distance phone calls have gotten so much cheaper.
A long-distance bus service now links the cities.
The development of long-distance commerce led to greater cultural contacts between continents.

children.name: long-haul
children.definition: long-haul flight/aircraft etctravelling long distances: đường dài
examples: It’s so much nicer to fly business class on long-haul flights.

children.name: long-haul routes between Europe and Asia
not travelling or reaching a long distance
short-range
children.definition: short-range missile/gun etca weapon that can only hit sth that is a short distance away: cự li ngắn
examples: Short-range missiles in Asia do not pose a direct threat to the U.S.

children.name: short-haul
children.definition: short-haul flight/aircraft etconly travelling short distances: đường ngắn
examples: The airline plans to increase the number of short-haul flights between European capitals.

children.name: drop
children.definition: a distance from a higher point down to the ground or to a lower point : khoảng cách dốc ngược hoặc dựng đứng
examples: There's a dropoftwo metres from the window to the ground.
There was a steep drop on one side of the track.

children.name: a 20-metre drop
examples: There was an almostsheer(= vertical )dropto the valley below.
